action.action-desc: Mr. Finstad (for himself and Mr. Riley of New York) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act to modify limitations on access to farm ownership loans for beginning farmers and ranchers.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Next Generation Farmer Act.
Section 302(b) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7 U.S.C. 1922(b)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking 3 years and inserting 1 year; and
by striking paragraph (4) and inserting the following:
In the case of a qualified beginning farmer or rancher, the Secretary may waive the 1-year requirement in paragraph (1) if the farmer or rancher has—

subparagraph.text: at least 1 year of experience as hired farm labor with substantial management responsibilities; or

an established relationship with an individual who has experience in farming or ranching, or is a retired farmer or rancher, and is participating as a counselor in a Service Corps of Retired Executives program authorized under section 8(b)(1)(B) of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 637(b)(1)(B)), or with a local farm or ranch operator or organization, approved by the Secretary, that is committed to mentoring the farmer or rancher.
